poem:
Title: The Sorrow of Sand

From the heartland of Euphrates,
Rises the stench of bitter deceit.
Golden grains sold for silver tongues,
Lining pockets, in shadows meet.
Shadow-shapes on ancient bricks,
Ghosts of honest men once stood,
Their whispers lost in wind-swept halls,
Replaced by slyness in the Brotherhood.
Phoenix arising - or moral descents?
Depends on the coin's fickle glare.
From each UN eye - an indifferent squint,
Meet a world's despairing stare.
